instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP3V0_G3H: What is PP3V0_G3H? PP3V0_G3H is a 3.0v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state..
definitions.PP1V8_SUS: What is PP1V8_SUS? PP1V8_SUS is a 1.8v power rail active in a suspend state..
definitions.PP1V8_S4: What is PP1V8_S4? PP1V8_S4 is a 1.8v power rail when the machine is in an S4, suspend to disk state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no reason
threads.message:
Hello,

History: dead while watching a movie on a plane without charger.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board without battery, unplugged all connectors takes from charger:
20.03V
0.03A

On thermal camera:
a little heat on <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>

Power rails:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 13,7
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 20,36
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,4
<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H</SIGNAL> 0,045
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP0V6_S3_MEM_VREFDQ_A</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SUS</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S4</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_S0SW</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_T139</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_T139</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5,03
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 0 SHORT
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4SW_ISNS</SIGNAL> 0
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0V SHORT
<SIGNAL>P3PV3S5_EN</SIGNAL> 3,42
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS0</SIGNAL> 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0

seems like CPU shorted?
thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no reason
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H</SIGNAL> 0,045 "
Is this diode mode reading?
In such case, is too low...

Only few caps there to check, <CAPACITOR>C7880</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1227</CAPACITOR>/28.
If all good, then only <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, or CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no reason
threads.message:
Thanks
<CAPACITOR>C7880</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C1227</CAPACITOR>/28 are good.
<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> can be replaced from other boards? or it's possible to test this ic without replacing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no reason
threads.message:
Remove <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and check diode mode again.
If still low, dead CPU...
